record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Incident Management menu" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: This is the main menu for the Incident Management module.
From this menu, you may access the various items contained within Incident Management.
Service Manager only displays the keys that your individual capabilities allow.

detail.detail: F1 - Document Management: Calls the Incident Management driver application. Depending on your individual capabilities, it enables you to browse, open, update, close, and print Incident records. The command to run this option is "dm".

F2 - Assignment Group File: Calls the Incident assignment group table using Database Manager. It enables you to browse and maintain Incident assignment groups. The command to run this option is "assign".
F3 - MAIN MENU: Returns you to the main menu. The command to run this option is "main".

F4 - Category File: Calls the Incident category table using Database Manager. It enables you to browse and maintain Incident categories. The command to run this option is "category". Use the F10 (Create New Category) key when creating new categories requiring new forms.
F5 - Resolution File: Calls the Incident resolution table using Database Manager. It enables you to browse and maintain standard resolutions. The command to run this option is "resol".
F6 - Doc Mgmt Analysis Reports: Sends you to the Incident Analysis Reporting menu. The command to run this option is "dmrpts".
F7 - Assignment Group Listing: Runs the Incident assignment group listing using the report exerciser. The command to run this option is "asgnlist".
F8 - Category Listing: Runs the Incident category listing using the report exerciser. The command to run this option is "catlist".
F9 - Resolution Code Listing: Runs the standard Incident resolution listing using the report exerciser. The command to run this option is "reslist".
F10 - Create New Category: Calls the create Incident category application.
Use this key when creating categories requiring new forms. The command to run this option is "createcat".
